page.title: 01North of Benmore Lodge
page.content: The west half of the block is mainly the glen containing the upper reaches of the River Oykel, which is famous for its salmon fishing although it is not fished in this part. In square 02330914, there is a loch which feeds the River Oykel. There is a path by the side of the River Oykel going up to the head of the glen and it branches off beside the tributary from Loch Sail an Ruathair. This branch goes a long way north. These paths are used often by the keeper at Benmore to take home the deer he culls. There is a turf cross at 0234209146, probably used for sheltering sheep. There are also two stalls at 0234309149 and 023332509146. Two ruined houses are at 0233409139 and 0232509146.
